clinical_study.brief_title: PD1 Antibody and Lenalidomide as a Treatment for EBV-HLH or CAEBV
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Trial of Programmed Cell Death Protein 1(PD1) Antibody and Lenalidomide as a Treatment for Epstein-Barr Virus-associated Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis or Chronic Active EBV Infection(CAEBV)

brief_summary.textblock: The present study was a prospective one-arm clinical study, in which EBV-HLH/chronic active EBV infection patients were selected as the main subjects to evaluate the effect of PD-1 antibody and lenalidomide regimens on ebv-dna and safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 years
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events including thyroid function， liver function damage, myelosuppression, infection, bleeding and so on.
from the date of inclusion to date of death, irrespective of cause Adverse Events

arm_group.description: PD-1 antibody and lenalidomide administered in 2 week cycles for 6 cycles.

intervention.description: 2mg/kg ivgtt on day 1(age<18 years); 200mg ivgtt on day 1(age >=18 years).
5mg orally once a day（age<18years) ,day 1-14; 10mg orally once a day(age>=18years), day 1-14.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients were older than 1 years of age.
2. According to the HLH-04 diagnostic criteria, it meets the HLH diagnostic criteria. EBV infection occurs in cells with EBV-DNA copy number significantly increased in peripheral blood or tissue, or where EBV coding small RNA(EBER) is detected in tissue or peripheral blood. Or Straus' 1988 diagnostic criteria for CAEBV.
3. EBV-HLH or CAEBV are in remission.
4. Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Heart function above grade II (NYHA).
2. Pregnancy or lactating Women.
3. Allergic to PD-1 antibody or lenalidomide.
4. Active bleeding of the internal organs.
5. uncontrollable infection.
6. Participate in other clinical research at the same time.
